New Records: Mitchell Marsh's score of 177 is the second-highest individual score of the World Cup
Key Match Events: Australia completed a record chase of 307 runs, their biggest in World Cups
Pre-Game Insights: Australia lost their first two games, but bounced back to win seven on the trot to seal a spot in the semi-finals
Post-Match Reflections: Australia will now shift their focus to South Africa and the Eden Gardens
For Bangladesh, the defeat marks the end of a dour campaign, but at least they have ensured they get to the Champions Trophy
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is not just Mitchell Marsh's highest ODI score, but also the second-highest in the World Cup
Others: Australia's chase of 291 against Afghanistan in their last game was their biggest in World Cups
